com.mokiat.data.front.scanner

Class MTLLimitingScannerHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mokiat.data.front.scanner.MTLLimitingScannerHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IMTLScannerHandler

    public class MTLLimitingScannerHandler
extends Object
implements IMTLScannerHandler
    This implementation of the IMTLScannerHandler assures that some events do not exceed a custom specified threshold. Should that happen, an WFSizeException is thrown.

    Most common usage of this class is to assure that during loading the file is within reasonable size and that the application will not fail with an OutOfMemoryError.

    THis class implements the decorator pattern, so you need to specify another handler to which all events will be forwarded after they have passed a threshold check.

    Author:
    Momchil Atanasov

      • MTLLimitingScannerHandler

        public MTLLimitingScannerHandler(IMTLScannerHandler delegate,
                                 MTLLimits limits)
        Creates a new MTLLimitingScannerHandler with the specified delegate IMTLScannerHandler and MTLLimits.
        Parameters:
        delegate - handler to which events will be delegated on success.
        limits - object specifying the scanning limits after which an WFSizeException is thrown.
        See Also:
        MTLLimits

      • onAmbientColorRGB

        public void onAmbientColorRGB(IFastFloat r,
                              IFastFloat g,
                              IFastFloat b)
                       throws WFException
        Description copied from interface: IMTLScannerHandler
        Called when an ambient color definition (Ka) has been read and it specifies an RGB model of the color.

        The specification allows for the MTL resource to specify only Red component in which case the others should be considered the same. Depending on the implementation of this interface, it is possible that it will always do this resolution on itself or it may decide to leave it to the user.
        The former provides easier usage, whereas the latter provides unaltered resource input.

        Specified by:
        onAmbientColorRGB in interface IMTLScannerHandler
        Parameters:
        r - the Red value, will not be null.
        g - the Green value, will be null if unavailable.
        b - the Blue value, will be null if unavailable.
        Throws:
        WFException - can be thrown by users to terminate any further scanning of the resource.

      • onDissolve

        public void onDissolve(IFastFloat amount)
                throws WFException
        Description copied from interface: IMTLScannerHandler
        Called when a dissolve statement (d) has been read.

        Dissolve can be better considered as opacity, where a value of 0 indicates full transparency and a value of 1 indicates full opacity.

        Specified by:
        onDissolve in interface IMTLScannerHandler
        Parameters:
        amount - the dissolve amount, will not be null.
        Throws:
        WFException - can be thrown by users to terminate any further scanning of the resource.
